hypothesis_content.title: Fed QT End Liquidity Pump → Crypto Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following the announced end of Fed QT and $13.5B liquidity injection, a 3-day period of suppressed BTC 24h realized volatility (<35%) within the NEUTRAL regime will be followed by a directional breakout exceeding 2.5x the recent ATR within the next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The end of quantitative tightening (QT) represents a structural shift in macro liquidity. Historically, such pivots precede asset reflation, but with a lag. The crypto market, post the 'October liquidity crash,' is in a fragile equilibrium. A period of low volatility (compression) after the news suggests absorption and positioning, creating a coiled spring setup. The concurrent growth in stablecoin supply provides the on-chain fuel for the move.
entry_conditions: BTC 24h Realized Volatility < 35% for 3 consecutive days
BTC price is within +/- 5% of its 20-day SMA
Aggregated Stablecoin Supply (USDT+USDC) shows net positive growth over prior 7 days

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves > 2.5x the 14-day ATR from entry point in either direction (capture breakout)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves > 1.5x the 14-day ATR against initial breakout direction after signal confirmation
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after entry if no breakout occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility remains suppressed (<40%) and price continues to range within +/- 1.5x ATR for 7+ days post-signal, indicating the liquidity injection was either insufficient or already priced, failing to catalyze a directional move.
